item.title: illustration process
item.description: when designing pictures plan don’t rush the planning stage. do sketch out the idea. try (red or blue) pencil draw character gesture first before any details: make the characters dynamic make sure the composition is solid test decide if it’s a [[high key or low key]] picture create flat masks for big elements.

item.title: word building process
item.description: from kenny vo streams keyframe sketch form language ideation derived from keyframe sketch individual prop design prop design added back to keyframe illustration

item.title: characters
item.description: start by showing the “character’s character”. design comes later when you’ve sold the idea of the character. advice from dave rapoza.

item.title: high key or low key
item.description: the key of an image describes which side of the terminator the details are. if details are on the light side, it’s high key if details are in the shadow side, it’s low key.

item.title: Art Update
item.description: It has been about 5 months since my last post. In that time, I’m kept on trying to improve my skills in art.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Eight to Eleven
item.description: Taking a break The next scene for my 6 sketches project involves a city. I quickly realized that I don’t know how to do them.

item.title: Watching time-lapse Art videos isn't good for you
item.description: I get it. Watching time-lapse videos of your favorite artists gives you a boost of motivation. It makes you want to paint your own ideas.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Six to Seven
item.description: Week 6 So it has been two weeks trying to create 6 sketches based on a story. In the first week, I tried creating a story or just an outline of a story that I could use to determine what my 6 story points would be.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Five
item.description: I feel like I learned a lot this week. I read “Framed Ink” in one day, might have gone through it too quickly.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Four
item.description: The problem that came up the previous week is my boring composition. Steven’s primary suggestion is to start with a horizon line.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Three
item.description: I did more of the same exercises as the previous week. Still a bit unproductive though, I got hooked with playing “No Man’s Sky”.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week Two
item.description: This week was unproductive. I tried my best to do the exercise but I struggled to get myself to put something on the canvas.

item.title: Art Mentorship Week One
item.description: If you donâ€™t already know, I love art. I love looking at them, and I try to make my own as well.
